page.title: 17SHOPPING
page.content:
In our survey we discovered that families who owned cars bought most of their groceries, meat, bread, fruit and vegetables outside our survey area.They drove either to Richmod, Northallerton or Darlington.
Shoes and clothes were bought mainly in Darlington where there is a wider selection of shops.Quite a large proportion of people, however, chose shoes and clothing from catalogues.
The shops in Scorton village are found useful by older people and those who do not drive.Children buy most of their sweets in them.
Travelling shops are appreciated by those in outlying areas, especially if they are not near the bus route.
